intro: Neochilenia, commonly known as the "lily of the valley" in some regions, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Liliaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. Neochilenia species are native to various parts of South America, particularly in the Andes region. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plants have linear leaves and produce small, fragrant flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
